alert.note: Alert for Archer; Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 9:03PM CST until February 26 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Jefferson County in southern Oklahoma... Southeastern Cotton County in southwestern Oklahoma... Clay County in northern Texas... Eastern Archer County in northern Texas... Southeastern Wichita County in northern Texas... * Until 945 PM CST. * At 902 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Randlett to 3 miles north of Olney, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Henrietta, Waurika, Archer City, Ryan, Petrolia, Scotland, Byers, Dean, Randlett, Windthorst, Terral, Bellevue, Jolly, Sugden, Bluegrove, Grady, Oscar, Lake Arrowhead and Sheppard AFB. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
